## Gene Details:
- **Gene ID:** [AT2G40850](https://www.arabidopsis.org/locus?name=AT2G40850)
- **Gene Symbol:** <u>ATPI4K GAMMA 1, PI4K GAMMA 1</u>
- **Gene Name:** phosphoinositide 4-kinase gamma 1, phosphoinositide 4-kinase gamma 1
- **Description:**   phosphoinositide 4-kinase gamma 1;(source:Araport11)
- **TAIR Accession:** 
- **Genome:** [Araport11_genome_release](https://www.arabidopsis.org/download/list?dir=Genes%2FAraport11_genome_release)
- **Species:** *Arabidopsis thaliana*

## Transcripts:
   -  [AT2G40850.1](https://www.arabidopsis.org/gene?name=AT2G40850.1)
## Germplasm Phenotype:
   - [SALK_022689]()&nbsp;---&nbsp;Anthers of plants homozygous for a T-DNA insertion in At2g40850 contained only a small number of pollen grains, and consequently, few seeds were produced per plant. Microscopic examination of the mutant anthers revealed that meiosis, the earliest step of pollen formation, was not affected. However, after tetrads had formed, the cells of the tapetum showed abnormally enlarged vacuoles. Later in development, pollen grains exhibited irregular shapes and, in mature anthers, most of them had collapsed.
